document_data.name: Peacemen
document_data.mainbody: '''Peacemen''' and '''peacewomen''' were specialty priests devoted to [[Eldath]], the Goddess of Singing Waters.
document_data.Activities: These individuals were always [[half-elves]], [[halfling]]s, or [[sirine]]s. [[Elves]] and halflings tended to view peacemen with a raised eyebrow, finding them quite peculiar.
document_data.Abilities:
Peacemen gained a variety of magical abilities as they developed including ''[[remove fear]]'', ''[[sleep]]'', ''[[silence, 15' radius]]'', and ''[[Laeral's aqueous column]]''. These abilities could be used once or multiple times per day. Especially advanced peacemen had a form of ''[[sanctuary]]'' active on them at all times and could breathe underwater.

They could [[water walk|walk on water]] at will and were completely immune to the ''[[pain touch]]'' of [[Loviatar]].
document_data.Possessions: Though they only fought in order to defend themselves, peacemen could wield a variety of weapons in combat including [[net]]s, [[whip]]s, [[staves]], [[club]]s, [[sling]]s, and [[staff sling]]s. They were particularly adept at parrying attacks. They never donned [[armor]].
document_data.Notable Peacemen and Peacewomen: *[[Milissa]] of [[Ravens Bluff]], a swimming instructor and a retired adventurer who sough to finance construction of a Temple to Eldath in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite polyhedron/72/The Living City: Swimming Lessons|6}}
